We have a winner! Thank you to the 15 submissions for the Recreating Art Contest! These 15 works of art received over 4,000 views on our Palos Heights School District 128 Facebook Page, 504 total "likes" and 362 votes on the Google Form!

Congratulations to Daphne and Mikey Galason and their recreation of American Gothic by Grant Wood with 386 "likes" and votes!

Special mention to our runners up: Molly Knor and her recreation of Girl With the Pearl Earrings by Johannes Vermeer with 119 "likes" and votes AND Anthony Gumuls and his recreation of The Great Wave Off Kanagawa by Katsushika Hokusai with 88 "likes" and votes!

Thank you to everyone who participated and voted! It was a lot of fun! Our next district family activity is coming soon! Stay tuned!

post_text:
Sharing Governor Pritzker’s words to all students...I agree with his sentiment that I can’t wait to see what you’ll accomplish!

And to children of all ages – this is a very strange moment that you’re living in. Your parents and I didn’t experience something like this when we were kids – but I can tell you for sure that the hard things we did live through, we learned from. And you’re going to learn from this. You’re going to see what it looks like when the world comes together, and what it looks like to put your faith in science, and research, and the teams of people here in Illinois and beyond who are working on treatments and vaccines to save lives. We will get to their other side of this, and that other side will be a place that appreciates the best of the before, but with a greater sense of compassion and connection. And the best part is that you are going to be the ones guiding us forward. All of you, with your creativity, your passion, and your care for others are going to shape our future. Let me be the first to say, I can’t wait to see all that you accomplish.

post_text: On Saturday, March 7, 2020, at Richards High School, fifteen Independence Junior High School students participated in the SSJHSC Speech Conference. It was a great end to a phenomenal season with a talented group of competitors who performed declamation, poetry, and prose to bring home the first place trophy for the fourth year in a row with three first place Conference Champion titles in 7th Grade Prose, Harry Stroobosscher, 8th Grade Declamation, Reem Naser; 8th Grade Poetry, Jack Siriann. The team came home with 14 individual honors. The fifteen accomplished IJHS Speech team consists of Kiara Burton, Alexa Castor, Brigid Doherty, Joey Gumuls, Maggie Gleason, Maggie Klinger, Reem Naser, Aya Mustafa, Guilia Scarnavack, Jack Siriann, Elizabeth Stepuszek, Harry Stroobosscher, Brenda Ramirez, Enzo Restivo, and Emma Riley
